utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And I’m Dr. Amy Farrah Fowler.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And welcome to the first on location episode of Dr. Sheldon Cooper and Dr. Amy Farrah Fowler present…

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Dr. Sheldon Cooper’s Fun with Flags.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hit it.

utterance.speaker: Howard (singing)
utterance.content: For joy and fun there’s no better manner than to fly a pennant flag or banner.

utterance.speaker: Raj (singing)
utterance.content: What fills my heart and makes my eyes moist? Sending a flag up a pole on a hoist.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Fun with flags, fun with flags.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh say can you see, it’s fun with flags.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Fun with flags.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: As you may notice, just one of the changes around here is our new house band.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who haven’t learned their place yet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’re also coming to you live from a different apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr. Fowler and I began an experiment in living together after her apartment became water damaged. This is our friend Penny’s place. You may remember her from our episode, Flags and the People Who Don’t Understand Them.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, in the spirit of cohabitation, the theme of today’s episode is flags of two regions coming together as one. Such as the flag of St. Kitts and Nevis.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, let’s roll up our sleevis and get to know Nevis. Well, I, I like that, but next time check with me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you know that the flag was designed by a student named Edrice Lewis…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe I’m saying this, but can we watch the news or something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s cute, they’re having fun living together.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I wonder what they’re gonna do when her apartment’s ready.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Actually, it’s been ready for weeks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, they finished the work early, but she’s been telling Sheldon they’re behind schedule.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, she’s just been lying to him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’ve lied to Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but to make him leave, not to make him stay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Buda and Pest united to form Budapest. And that’s why Budapest is the Budabest. Now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for your services, gentlemen. Now, I’m hoping to broaden our audience with your youthful rock and roll music.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Aw, you think you have an audience, that’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We don’t get paid? Nothing? Not even a sandwich?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s almost dinner time. You in the mood for anything?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, we could get Thai food near your apartment and then drop in and check on the progress.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, you don’t want do that, it’s a construction zone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, what about your fear of stray nails and butt cracks?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am terrified of stepping on a nail and falling into a butt crack.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Anyway, how about dinner?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, if you’d like, I could call your landlord and complain.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thanks, but you don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t mind, I’m very good at complaining. If it were an Olympic sport, I’d complain about what a stupid sport it is and then I’d take home the gold.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good stuff. So, uh, what about dinner?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it me, or are you purposely changing the subject?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. And on the subject of subjects, is your use of the word subject the same or different as when we speak about the subject of a king?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have a feeling you’re still doing it. But I find that topic irresistible, so, now, in ancient Mesopotamia, the king referred to the people as his property.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m serious, JPL’s actually developing a robot arm that could grab an asteroid before it hits us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So their plan for saving the Earth from Armageddon is hoping a bunch of scientists can catch a ball?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If we’re all gonna die, why am I eating so much kale?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re awful quiet, everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m concerned about Amy. She’s acting a bit odd lately.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Well, just out of curiosity, what registers as odd to you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Her behaviour. No, I have the feeling that she’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wouldn’t worry about it. She’s probably just distracted by work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, whatever it is, it’s troubling me. And I can’t eat, I can’t sleep. And don’t even ask about the consistency of my bowel movements.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You heard him, guys, don’t ask.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would she keep something from me, you know? I shared my body with that woman. And my Netflix password. They recommended Stella Got Her Groove Back because of her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Buddy, buddy, listen, nothing bad is going on, she just, she just didn’t want you to know that the work on her apartment was finished a couple weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s enjoying living with you and she didn’t want it to end early.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, she’s deceiving me in order to spend more time with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I feel both flattered and hurt. Like when people say I look like that skeleton from Nightmare Before Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh my God, that’s who you look like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, this is not a big deal. It’s a little white lie, everyone does it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not me, I’m a hundred percent honest in all of my relationships.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And how single are you right now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Eating cake on the toilet single.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I won’t tolerate deception in my relationship. I have no choice but to confront her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t do that, you’ve got gold here. Hang onto it until you’re in trouble and then throw it in her face.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you tell him that? That’s terrible advice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you wouldn’t want to have anything on Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, of course not.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, if I actually know something right now, and I do, you don’t want me to tell you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll take that as a yes. She’s secretly been moving your collectibles into storage a little at a time and you haven’t noticed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: See, I’ve known that for weeks, but, you know, I waited till the moment when it would cause him the most pain.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Superman’s gone, my stormtrooper’s gone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your Klingon word-of-the-day calendar’s gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d say damn it in Klingon, but that wasn’t until next month.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s khoo-vakh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Khoo-vakh! She took my Where’s Waldo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, he’s over there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, there he is.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, what’s the deal with your apartment? Why’s it taking so long?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Um, it was a drywall problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, the drywall got wet, and you do not want wet drywall because when drywall gets wet, it’s really more…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wet wall?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Or damp wall, just as bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm. So why don’t they just get more drywall?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, they went to get some, but the woman at the wall store said it was going on sale and they should wait because the savings…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, are you done? Bernadette told me your apartment’s ready.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was done at wet wall, but you wouldn’t let it go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But is Sheldon really believing all this crap?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, he started to question it, but then I fake sneezed on him and he ran to take a shower. Please don’t say anything, I feel terrible about this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, don’t worry, I won’t.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: The woman at the wall store?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let it go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you going to confront Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Eventually, I guess. Although, I am kind of curious how long she thinks she can keep hiding my stuff without me knowing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. You know, perhaps instead of confronting them, we should see how far they’re willing to spin their tangled webs. Like that Spider-Man action figure that used to be on your desk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my God, I’m going blind.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Food’s here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent. I’m very hungry. Speaking of which, what’s going on with your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, uh, they’re still working on it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. Very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, we swung by her apartment on the way to the restaurant, and they’re gonna be fixing it for a while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, uh, you saw her apartment?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I did, still a mess.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: jlyajbe’. DaH nep’a’ Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: jISovbe’

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why are you speaking Klingon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you speaking English?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Penny, do you remember when I taught you Ubbi Dubbi?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ubabsubolubutubly ubi duboo.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ubexcubellent. Duboes Shubeldubon knubow ubi’m lubyubing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ubif Lubenubard tubold hubim, ubit’s pubossubibuble.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, wait, stop that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You stop that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dayaj’a’

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: ghobe’

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Qu’vatlh

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. That’s enough. You know what? What is going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, I told Sheldon that her apartment’s been finished, but then you just said it’s not, so now I’m all confused.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny was just covering for me. My place has been ready for two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How could you lie to me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, she’s enjoyed living with you. It’s called being in love.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm-hmm, and what’s it called when you secretly get rid of all your husband’s stuff?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Tha… That is not true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bernadette told Howard, Howard told me, plus, I can see all my stuff is gone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, so, you believe your friend, and your friend’s wife and your own eyes over me? Wow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You really didn’t think I’d notice my stuff was missing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, did you notice your key chain?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where’s Batman?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why did you tell Howard I was hiding Leonard’s things?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: One sec. Why did you tell Leonard I told you Penny was hiding his things?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It just came up because we, we were talking about secrets and… wait, juH qachHom Dotlh Sov ‘Iv

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Everybody stop it with that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not really a part of this, so I’m just gonna dig in.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And I’d like to know why you blabbed about my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re up, blabby.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have said anything.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess it’s okay. I’m sorry that I lied about my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s all right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And what? Your wizard robes are next to go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now that everything’s out on the table, you, you think you two will keep living together?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Despite recent events, I do consider our experiment in cohabitation to have been positive.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you saying you’d like to live with me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m open to the possibility.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ubamy bube cubool.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, if he moves across the hall for good, Leonard could keep the stuff you don’t like in Sheldon’s old room. Solves everything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s a great idea.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ooh, maybe I could turn it into a gaming den.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That would be amazing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wuh wuh hold on, excuse me, that’s my room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But you won’t be living here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But that’s my room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But you won’t be living here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But that’s my room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You guys might want to start eating. But you won’t be living here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, once you stop paying rent, none of this is really yours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But that’s my room.

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: But you won’t be living here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you for understanding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, I get it. Everybody wants to spend more time with me. I’m like a man made of sugar in a world of ants.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Night. If we did continue living together, would it be here?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. It, it could be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course there’s, there’s always your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure, sure, we, we could live in my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hate your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry, you brought it up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I suppose we could find a whole new place. You know, and, technically, we don’t even have to stay in Pasadena. We could, we could move to Altadena or a place that doesn’t even end in dena.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s kind of exciting. I mean we could do whatever we want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But what if we move and we don’t like it? What if there’s a smoker in the building? Or pets? Or there could be mould? There could be traffic noise. I’m gonna have to learn a whole new bus route. Are you trying to soothe me by singing the Star Trek theme as a lullaby?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not a child, don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you know 2001: A Space Odyssey? All right, now that’s soothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I get it, this is still my room, we haven’t really made it yours.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Which is why I got you this Pink Power Ranger. Put it anywhere you like.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, but you may feel some discomfort.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m kidding, I want you to feel at home here. Decorate it any way that makes you happy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you really mean that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I really do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great, and just so you know, I’m not getting rid of all your stuff.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah? What are you keeping?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That candle and you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about my robot poster?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uhbubububuh, I can make do with just the candle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m struggling with the thought of leaving my old bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can it be more of an internal struggle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need to see it. While I’m gone, don’t breathe on my pillow.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How about if I just don’t breathe at all?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s my girl. What on earth? What is going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We turned your room into a sex dungeon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (waking up in bed)
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, last question. The chaps he was wearing, assless?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can we just focus on the decision I’m facing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We can, but for the record, all chaps are assless.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, please, this is a significant decision. Now, do Amy and I continue living together? Or do I move back in with Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Over my assless chaps you will.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This isn’t complicated. Do you love Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you like living with her?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you know what you need to do now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Apparently, figure this out on my own ’cause you guys are no help at all.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m just contemplating Buridan’s donkey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I understand. I’ll leave you be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, you’re familiar with the reference?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course. Jean Buridan proposed a philosophical thesis stating that a hungry donkey placed between two equidistant bales of hay would be paralysed by indecision and would starve to death.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t want you to starve to death, so here’s an eggplant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, some people believe that Buridan was plagiarizing Aristotle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Although, in Aristotle’s example, he proposed an equally hungry and thirsty man caught between food and drink.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Huh. Yeah, I wonder if that’s related to the 12th century Persian philosopher, Al-Ghazali and his story of a man caught between two dates.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you suggesting Al-Ghazali was Aristotelian? ‘Cause if anything, he was anti-Aristotelian.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Al-Ghazali was anti-Aristotelian? Boy, you think you know a guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Open your eyes and see your new room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know I went a little overboard. We can always dial it back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, it’s, it’s important to me that you have the bedroom you want.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that means so much. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just hiding some stuff in your closet, don’t tell Penny.
